sentences.en: Clever talk and ingratiating manner are seldom found in a virtuous man.
Even well - disposed people back away from Jack when they see that ingratiating smile.
sentences.cn: 即使是乐于助人的人,见到杰克那副阿谀奉承的笑脸,也要退避三舍.

sentences.en: Even worse, Hopkins started ingratiating himself with President.
sentences.cn: 更糟糕的是, 霍普金斯开始巴结总统.

sentences.en: He said this with an ingratiating smile.
sentences.cn: 他面带奉承地笑着说了这番话。

sentences.en: He wrote an ingratiating letter to his victim offering empathy, rather than just apologies.
sentences.cn: 他写了一封虚情假意的信给受害者,显示出自己的同感同情, 而不仅仅表达歉意.

sentences.en: His fellow students had found him too ingratiating.
sentences.cn: 他的同学们发现他太爱奉承了。

sentences.en: It’s also possible that our experience was not at all representative of the charm and ingratiating qualities pit bulls can demonstrate.
sentences.cn: 当然也有可能，即，以我们的经历，还够不上匹配斗牛犬所表现出来的那种迷人魅力以及谄媚能力。

sentences.en: Mollenhauer cast him an ingratiating smile, and as he stepped out Senator Simpson Walked in.
sentences.cn: 当他跨出去参议员辛浦生走进来的时候,莫仑霍对他巴结地一笑.

sentences.en: Mr Obama's body language was easy without being ingratiating.
sentences.cn: 奥巴马的肢体语言既随和,又无逢迎之意.

sentences.en: On your first meeting, they can be well-poised and ingratiating, and can seem like they'd make great bosses, but that changes quickly once you start working for them.
sentences.cn: 在你们的第一次会面时，他们风采翩翩，令人愉悦，也看上去会是个不错的老板，但是，一旦你为他们开始工作，事情就变了。

sentences.en: Polchenko is civil , almost ingratiating , as he argues with the leader.
sentences.cn: 波尔钦科 和这个头头辩论时也彬彬有礼, 甚至有点迎合奉承.

words.tran_cn: 逢迎的，讨好的；迷人的，吸引人的

trans.tran_en: If you describe someone or their behaviour as ingratiating, you mean that they try to make people like them

trans.tran_cn: 讨好，谄媚( ingratiate的现在分词 )
